alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 11:12AM CDT until May 24 at 2:31AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River at Taberville. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.3 feet, The handicapped access to the Osage River launch area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.3 feet this evening. It will then fall to 21.1 feet and begin rising again early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage Saturday morning and continue to rise to 23.6 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.5 feet on 01/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Thu 1pm 1am 1pm &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
